Sentencas: The chemical interaction study of AO-SiO2-B2O3-Y2O3 (A = Ba, Sr) (BaY, SrY) glass with high-temperature electrolyte yttria-stabilized zirconia (YSZ 8 mol%) is reported as a function of different heat treatment durations.
Titulo: Interaction Study of Yttria-Based Glasses with High-Temperature Electrolyte for SOFC

Sentencas: The as-prepared glass with 10 mol% of yttria shows limited amount of crystallization at 800 degrees C. Due to this yttria-based glasses BaY and SrY have been chosen to make diffusion couples with high-temperature electrolyte and interconnect material.
Titulo: Interaction Study of Yttria-Based Glasses with High-Temperature Electrolyte for SOFC

Sentencas: These diffusion couples have been heat treated at 850 degrees C, for 100, 200, and 500 h.
Titulo: Interaction Study of Yttria-Based Glasses with High-Temperature Electrolyte for SOFC

Sentencas: The heat-treated diffusion couples have been characterized using X-ray diffraction (XRD), scanning electron microscopy (SEM), and energy dispersive spectroscopy (EDS).
Titulo: Interaction Study of Yttria-Based Glasses with High-Temperature Electrolyte for SOFC

Sentencas: Microstructural analysis of diffusion couples shows absence of any undesired oxides and detrimental reaction products at the interface.
Titulo: Interaction Study of Yttria-Based Glasses with High-Temperature Electrolyte for SOFC

Sentencas: The glass has shown good bonding characteristics and absence of cracks, pores, or any kind of delamination from YSZ.
Titulo: Interaction Study of Yttria-Based Glasses with High-Temperature Electrolyte for SOFC

Sentencas: Apart from this, SrY and BaY glass seals have also shown good adhesion characteristics with Crofer 22 APU, even after 500 h at 850 degrees C.
Titulo: Interaction Study of Yttria-Based Glasses with High-Temperature Electrolyte for SOFC

Sentencas: The morphology and microstructure of the glass matrix suggest limited amount of devitrification in the glass.
Titulo: Interaction Study of Yttria-Based Glasses with High-Temperature Electrolyte for SOFC
